revised_title: Harry Harris: A Pioneering Figure in Human Biochemical Genetics
tldr: Harry Harris was a prominent scientist in the field of human genetics, known for his extensive research on genetic variation in health and disease. He demonstrated that genetic variation is common and usually harmless, paving the way for concepts like DNA fingerprinting and prenatal diagnosis of genetic disorders. Harris made significant contributions to the understanding of human genetics and was widely recognized for his work.
